title: Debug Console

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Debug Console is a tool exclusive to the Steam and the iOS closed beta client. It has a set of commands that may prove useful for debugging technical issues on the client or setting several preferences. A list of commands can be viewed by typing ? in the console.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Developer console
The Debug Console.

The Debug Console is a tool exclusive to the Steam and the iOS closed beta client. It has a set of commands that may prove useful for debugging technical issues on the client or setting several preferences. A list of commands can be viewed by typing ? in the console.

To open the console on desktop, hold down Alt and then press the ` (quote/grave accent), or by swiping down 4 fingers on the iOS beta client.

Commands[edit | edit source]

Command Result
? Lists the commands.
buildinfo [copy/print] Toggles client build info display. buildinfo copy results in the info being copied to the clipboard, with buildinfo print instead printing it into the debug console.
chattimestamp Toggles the chat timestamps function within the Settings.
cls Clears the console screen.
consolebounds [<x> <y> <width> <height>] Sets the boundaries for the debug console to the parameters specified. Defaults to a size of 500x200 pixels.
displayfps Shows the client's current frames per second and memory usage (KB).
mouseovertext Toggles the "Show mouseover text" functionality within the Settings.
prefs <name> <value> Sets player specific preferences. prefs -List shows a list of preferences available.
redrawminimap Forces the minimap to be rerendered.
reloadhighlights Usage unknown.
renderself Toggles the player's character model visibility to themselves.
setwindowsize <width> <height> Sets the size of the client's window.
setwindowtopmost Toggles whether the client will always be on top of other windows/applications.
toggleantidrag Toggles whether items in the inventory can only be moved when holding down the Shift key.
toggleroof Toggles whether roofs are selectively or always hidden.
uiquality Changes the quality of the UI. Can choose between 0 (Nearest-Neighbour), 1 (Linear), and 2 (Bicubic).

Preferences[edit | edit source]

Preferences can be changed by typing prefs <name> <value> into the console.

Preference Result
AmbientVolume Changes the area sound volume. Can choose from 0 to 127.
Brightness Changes the brightness. Can choose from 0 to 100.
ChatTimeStampMode Toggles whether timestamps are shown in the chatbox. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (server).
DisplayBuildInfo Toggles client build info display shown above.
DisplayFps Shows the client's current frames per second and memory usage (KB). Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
DrawDistance Changes the draw distance. Can choose from 25 to 90.
FpsLimit Changes the frames per second limit.
Fullscreen Sets the game window to take up the entirity of screen monitor in a borderless, non-resizeable window. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
HideUserName Usage unknown.
MidiVolume Changes the music volume. Can choose from 0 to 255.
MuteTitleScreen Mutes the login screen music. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
RemoveRoof Toggles whether roofs are selectively or always hidden. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
ScreenshotPath Changes the screenshot path.
UIQuality Changes the quality of the UI. Can choose between 0 (Nearest-Neighbour), 1 (Linear), and 2 (Bicubic).
WaveVolume Changes the sound effect volume. Can choose from 0 to 127.
WindowHeight Changes the height of the client.
WindowMode Changes the client layout. Can choose between 1 (fixed) and 2 (resizable).
WindowTopmost Changes whether the client is always on top. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
WindowWidth Changes the width of the client.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

The console interface featuring a small snow storm
  • As with RuneScape's Developer console counterpart, the console has snowflakes in its interface for the duration of the season of winter. The snow continues to pile up on the background until the interface is completely filled. Closing the interface or resizing the console window will reset or clear the snow inside the interface.

rawContent:
{{external|rs=Developer console}}
[[File:Debug Console.png|thumb|The Debug Console.]]
The '''Debug Console''' is a tool exclusive to the [[Steam Client|Steam]] and the [[Old School RuneScape Mobile|iOS closed beta client]]. It has a set of commands that may prove useful for debugging technical issues on the client or setting several preferences. A list of commands can be viewed by typing <kbd>?</kbd> in the console.

To open the console on desktop, hold down {{Key press|Alt}} and then press the {{Key press|`}} (quote/grave accent), or by swiping down 4 fingers on the iOS beta client.

==Commands==
{| class="wikitable"
!Command
!Result
|-
|<kbd>?</kbd>
|Lists the commands.
|-
|<kbd>buildinfo [copy/print]</kbd>
|Toggles client build info display. <kbd>buildinfo copy</kbd> results in the info being copied to the clipboard, with <kbd>buildinfo print</kbd> instead printing it into the debug console.
|-
|<kbd>chattimestamp</kbd>
|Toggles the [[Settings#Game Chat|chat timestamps]] function within the [[Settings]].
|-
|<kbd>cls</kbd>
|Clears the console screen.
|-
|<kbd>consolebounds [<x> <y> <width> <height>]</kbd>
|Sets the boundaries for the debug console to the parameters specified. Defaults to a size of 500x200 pixels.
|-
|<kbd>displayfps</kbd>
|Shows the client's current {{WP|frames per second}} and memory usage (KB).
|-
|<kbd>mouseovertext</kbd>
|Toggles the "Show mouseover text" functionality within the Settings.
|-
|<kbd>prefs <name> <value></kbd>
|Sets player specific preferences. <kbd>prefs -List</kbd> shows a list of preferences available.
|-
|<kbd>redrawminimap</kbd>
|Forces the [[minimap]] to be rerendered.
|-
|<kbd>reloadhighlights</kbd>
|Usage unknown.<!-- ? reloadhighlights doesn't result in anything -->
|-
|<kbd>renderself</kbd>
|Toggles the player's character model visibility to themselves.
|-
|<kbd>setwindowsize <width> <height></kbd> 
|Sets the size of the client's window.
|-
|<kbd>setwindowtopmost</kbd>
|Toggles whether the client will always be on top of other windows/applications.
|-
|<kbd>toggleantidrag</kbd>
|Toggles whether items in the [[inventory]] can only be moved when holding down the Shift key.
|-
|<kbd>toggleroof</kbd>
|Toggles whether roofs are selectively or always hidden.
|-
|<kbd>uiquality</kbd>
|Changes the quality of the UI. Can choose between 0 (Nearest-Neighbour), 1 (Linear), and 2 (Bicubic).
|}

==Preferences==
Preferences can be changed by typing <kbd>prefs <name> <value></kbd> into the console.
{| class="wikitable"
!Preference
!Result
|-
|<kbd>AmbientVolume</kbd>
|Changes the area sound volume. Can choose from 0 to 127.
|-
|<kbd>Brightness</kbd>
|Changes the brightness. Can choose from 0 to 100.
|-
|<kbd>ChatTimeStampMode</kbd>
|Toggles whether timestamps are shown in the chatbox. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (server). 
|-
|<kbd>DisplayBuildInfo</kbd>
|Toggles client build info display shown above.
|-
|<kbd>DisplayFps</kbd>
|Shows the client's current {{WP|frames per second}} and memory usage (KB). Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
|-
|<kbd>DrawDistance</kbd>
|Changes the draw distance. Can choose from 25 to 90.
|-
|<kbd>FpsLimit</kbd>
|Changes the {{WP|frames per second}} limit.
|-
|<kbd>Fullscreen</kbd>
|Sets the game window to take up the entirity of screen monitor in a borderless, non-resizeable window. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
|-
|<kbd>HideUserName</kbd>
|Usage unknown.
|-
|<kbd>MidiVolume</kbd>
|Changes the music volume. Can choose from 0 to 255.
|-
|<kbd>MuteTitleScreen</kbd>
|Mutes the login screen music. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
|-
|<kbd>RemoveRoof</kbd>
|Toggles whether roofs are selectively or always hidden. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
|-
|<kbd>ScreenshotPath</kbd>
|Changes the screenshot path.
|-
|<kbd>UIQuality</kbd>
|Changes the quality of the UI. Can choose between 0 (Nearest-Neighbour), 1 (Linear), and 2 (Bicubic).
|-
|<kbd>WaveVolume</kbd>
|Changes the sound effect volume. Can choose from 0 to 127.
|-
|<kbd>WindowHeight</kbd>
|Changes the height of the client.
|-
|<kbd>WindowMode</kbd>
|Changes the client layout. Can choose between 1 (fixed) and 2 (resizable).
|-
|<kbd>WindowTopmost</kbd>
|Changes whether the client is always on top. Can choose between 0 (off) and 1 (on).
|-
|<kbd>WindowWidth</kbd>
|Changes the width of the client.
|}

==Trivia==
[[File:Winter Debug Console.png|thumb|The console interface featuring a small snow storm]]
* As with ''RuneScape''<nowiki/>'s {{RSL|Developer console}} counterpart, the console has snowflakes in its interface for the duration of the season of winter. The snow continues to pile up on the background until the interface is completely filled. Closing the interface or resizing the console window will reset or clear the snow inside the interface.

{{Interface}}
